research_topic: Supply Chain Security for Configuration Templates and Policies
arxiv_queries: supply chain AND (configuration OR infrastructure-as-code OR template) AND (poisoning OR compromise) AND (2024 OR 2025)
artifact signing AND (integrity OR verification) AND (deployment OR configuration) AND (2024 OR 2025)
dependency security AND (Terraform OR Helm OR IaC) AND (vulnerability OR poisoning) AND (2024 OR 2025)
cat:cs.CR AND (package OR dependency OR build) AND (poisoning OR injection OR backdoor)

downloaded_papers.title: Characterizing Build Compromises Through Vulnerability Disclosure Analysis
downloaded_papers.abstract: Presents empirically-derived taxonomy of attack vectors targeting the build process through CVE mining of 621 vulnerability disclosures. Analyzes 168 documented supply chain attacks, identifying 40 incidents targeting build phases. Reveals 23.8% of supply chain attacks exploit build vulnerabilities, with dependency confusion and build script injection as most prevalent vectors.

downloaded_papers.title: Supply Chain Exploitation of Secure ROS 2 Systems: A Proof-of-Concept on Autonomous Platform Compromise via Keystore Exfiltration
downloaded_papers.abstract: Demonstrates proof-of-concept supply chain attack against Secure ROS 2 via Trojan-infected Debian package that exfiltrates keystore credentials. Shows impact on autonomous vehicle control including forced braking and acceleration. Highlights need for supply chain integrity controls and runtime semantic validation in DDS-based robotic systems.

downloaded_papers.title: One Detector Fits All: Robust and Adaptive Detection of Malicious Packages from PyPI to Enterprises
downloaded_papers.abstract: Introduces robust detector for malicious Python packages addressing adversarial obfuscation and varying FPR requirements across repositories and enterprises. Uses adversarial training with fine-grained code obfuscation. Detected 346 malicious packages from 91,949 PyPI packages with 2.48 daily detection rate and only 2.18 false positives.

downloaded_papers.title: Unveiling Malicious Logic: Towards a Statement-Level Taxonomy and Dataset for Securing Python Packages
downloaded_papers.abstract: Constructs statement-level dataset of 370 malicious Python packages (90,527 lines) with 2,962 labeled malicious indicators. Derives fine-grained taxonomy of 47 malicious indicators across 7 types and uncovers recurring attack workflows through sequential pattern mining. Enables explainable detection and behavior-centric defense mechanisms.

downloaded_papers.title: Granite: Granular Runtime Enforcement for GitHub Actions Permissions
downloaded_papers.abstract: Presents Granite, runtime proxy-based system enforcing fine-grained step-level permissions for GitHub Actions. Transparently monitors requests and checks against policies at runtime. Evaluation on 500 workflows shows 52.7% of jobs can be protected. Prevents permission misuse attacks with 55% overhead and reduces CI/CD attack surface.

downloaded_papers.title: Security Vulnerabilities in Software Supply Chain for Autonomous Vehicles
downloaded_papers.abstract: Analyzes security vulnerabilities in open-source software components in AV systems using static analyzers on Autoware, Apollo, and openpilot. Covers prevalent vulnerabilities and static analyzer comparisons. Emphasizes necessity of security best practices in SDLC to reduce cybersecurity risks in critical autonomous vehicle systems.

downloaded_papers.title: Wolves in the Repository: A Software Engineering Analysis of the XZ Utils Supply Chain Attack
downloaded_papers.abstract: Examines sophisticated XZ Utils attack (CVE-2024-3094) revealing new supply chain attack manipulating development processes, community management, and CI/CD. Reconstructs attack timeline and analyzes attacker tactics. Demonstrates how seemingly beneficial infrastructure contributions bypassed security measures in critical Linux library.

downloaded_papers.title: Establishing Workload Identity for Zero Trust CI/CD: From Secrets to SPIFFE-Based Authentication
downloaded_papers.abstract: Describes shift from static credentials to OIDC federation and introduces SPIFFE as runtime-issued identity model for non-human actors. Shows how SPIFFE enables policy alignment, workload attestation, and mutual authentication. Outlines next steps for policy-based access forming basis of Zero Trust CI/CD architecture.

downloaded_papers.title: TICAL: Trusted and Integrity-protected Compilation of AppLications
downloaded_papers.abstract: Presents Tical framework for trusted compilation providing integrity and confidentiality in build pipelines. Uses TEEs with file system shielding and immutable audit logs. Ensures compiler chain accesses only trusted files and verified output. Evaluation shows Tical protects CI/CD pipelines with acceptable performance overhead.

downloaded_papers.title: Binary Diff Summarization using Large Language Models
downloaded_papers.abstract: Proposes framework for binary diff summarization using LLMs combined with binary diffing for automated malware detection in supply chains. Introduces functional sensitivity score (FSS). Creates benchmark by injecting malware into 6 projects generating 104 binary versions. Achieves 0.98 precision, 0.64 recall and correctly detects XZ utils backdoor.

archived_papers.title: A Study of Malware Prevention in Linux Distributions
archived_papers.reason_archived: Broader distribution-level focus rather than configuration/template specific security

archived_papers.title: Models Are Codes: Towards Measuring Malicious Code Poisoning Attacks on Pre-trained Model Hubs

archived_papers.title: Reproducible Builds and Insights from an Independent Verifier for Arch Linux
archived_papers.reason_archived: Generic reproducible builds practice rather than configuration/template-specific
